com.novell.ldapchai.provider
Class ChaiProviderFactory

java.lang.Object
  com.novell.ldapchai.provider.ChaiProviderFactory

public final class ChaiProviderFactory
extends Object

Static factory methods for obtaining an ChaiProvider. ChaiProvider instances can be used directly, but they are more commonly used to obtain an ChaiEntry instance.

Access to "wrapped" ChaiProviders are also availble, including wrappers for caching or synchronization.

If there are no specific requirements for how to establish a connection, the "quick" factory method can be used to get a Provider with just one line of code: 

   ChaiProvider provider = ChaiProviderFactory.createProvider("ldap://host:port","cn=admin,o=org","password");

If a more control is required, allocate a ChaiConfiguration first, and then use this factory to generate a provider: 

   // setup connecton variables
   final String bindUsername = "cn=admin,o=org";
   final String bindPassword = "password";
   final List serverURLs = new ArrayList();
   serverURLs.add("ldap://server1:port");
   serverURLs.add("ldaps://server2:port");
   serverURLs.add("ldap://server3");
 

   // allocate a new configuration
   ChaiConfiguration chaiConfig = new ChaiConfiguration(
            serverURLs,
            bindUsername,
            bindPassword);
 

   // set any desired settings.
   chaiConfig.setSettings(ChaiConfiguration.SETTING_LDAP_TIMEOUT,"9000");
   chaiConfig.setSettings(ChaiConfiguration.SETTING_PROMISCUOUS_SSL,"true");
 

   // generate the new provider
   ChaiProvider provider = ChaiProviderFactory.createProvider(chaiConfig);

Author:
Jason D. Rivard

Method Detail

getChaiStatistics

public static ProviderStatistics getChaiStatistics()
Maintains the global chai provider statistics. All com.novell.ldapchai.provider.ChaiProvider instaces that have their ChaiSetting.STATISTICS_ENABLE set to true will register statistics in this global tracker.

Returns:
a ProviderStatistics instance containing global statistics for the Chai API

quickProvider

public static ChaiUser quickProvider(String ldapURL,
                                     String bindDN,
                                     String password)
                              throws ChaiUnavailableException
Create a ChaiUser using a standard JNDI ChaiProvider. If access to the ChaiProvider is also required, it can be had using the ChaiEntry.getChaiProvider() method of the returned ChaiUser instance.

Parameters:
bindDN - ldap bind DN, in ldap fully qualified syntax. Also used as the DN of the returned ChaiUser.
password - password for the bind DN.
ldapURL - ldap server and port in url format, example: ldap://127.0.0.1:389 (multiple addresses can be specified by comma seperating)
Returns:
A ChaiUser instance of the bindDN with an underlying ChaiProvider connected using the supplied parameters.
Throws:
ChaiUnavailableException - If the directory server(s) are not reachable.
See Also:
ChaiFactory.quickProvider(String,String,String)

createProvider

public static ChaiProvider createProvider(String ldapURL,
                                          String bindDN,
                                          String password)
                                   throws ChaiUnavailableException
Create a ChaiProvider using a standard (default) JNDI ChaiProvider.

Parameters:
bindDN - ldap bind DN, in ldap fully qualified syntax. Also used as the DN of the returned ChaiUser.
password - password for the bind DN.
ldapURL - ldap server and port in url format, example: ldap://127.0.0.1:389
Returns:
A ChaiProvider with an active connection to the ldap directory
Throws:
ChaiUnavailableException - If the directory server(s) are not reachable.

createProvider

public static ChaiProvider createProvider(ChaiConfiguration chaiConfiguration)
                                   throws ChaiUnavailableException
Create a ChaiProvider using the specified chaiConfiguration. A ChaiProvider will be created according to the implementation class and configuration settings contained within the configuration.

All other factory methods are simply convenience wrappers around this method.

Parameters:
chaiConfiguration - A completed, lockable configuration
Returns:
A functioning ChaiProvider generated according to chaiConfiguration
Throws:
ChaiUnavailableException - If the directory server(s) are not reachable.

synchronizedProvider

public static ChaiProvider synchronizedProvider(ChaiProvider theProvider)
Returns a thread-safe "wrapped" ChaiProvider. All ldap operations will be forced through a single lock and then sent to the backing provider.

Note that depending on the ldap server and the configured timeouts, calling methods on a synchronized provider may result in significant blocking delays.

Parameters:
theProvider - The provider to be "wrapped" in a synchronized provider.
Returns:
A synchronized view of the specified provider
